response:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: You can use the iterator to navigate to the next element in the sorted set and then use the tailSet() method to get the exclusive tail set starting from that element.
Here's an example:
private void exclusiveTailSet(SortedSet<String> s, String start) {
Iterator<String> i = s.iterator();
while (i.hasNext()) {
String current = i.next();
if (current.compareTo(start) < 0) {
break;
}
}
SortedSet<String> t = s.tailSet(start);
System.out.println(t); // [Start, Three, Two]
}
}

Explanation: The above code iterates through the sorted set and finds the first element that is greater than or equal to the given start element. It then uses the tailSet() method to get the exclusive tail set starting from that element.
